asap.realizer

Interface Player

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultPlayer

    public interface Player
    Elckerlyc player. A player belongs to a planner. A player can be reset (see e.g. BMLRealizer.reset()). In the future, more generic methods may be added to this interface...
    Author:
    Herwin van Welbergen, Dennis Reidsma

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Gracefully interrupts a behavior.
      void interruptBehaviourBlock(java.lang.String bmlId, double time)
      Gracefully stops all behaviors in the block; that is: calls their interrupt and removes them from the plan
      void play(double time)

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        void reset(double time)
        Reset the player, that is: stops all behaviors, then removes them from the plan and restores the startup state (default pose etc).

      • setBMLBlockState

        void setBMLBlockState(java.lang.String bmlId,
                      TimedPlanUnitState state)

      • updateTiming

        void updateTiming(java.lang.String bmlId)
        Updates the timing for all behaviors in bml block bmlId to reflect the current execution context (e.g. position of limbs).

      • stopBehaviourBlock

        void stopBehaviourBlock(java.lang.String bmlId,
                        double time)
        Stop all behaviors in the block; that is: calls their stop and removes them from the plan

      • stopBehaviour

        void stopBehaviour(java.lang.String bmlId,
                   java.lang.String behaviourId,
                   double time)
        Stop a behavior. That is: calls their stop and removes them from the plan

      • interruptBehaviourBlock

        void interruptBehaviourBlock(java.lang.String bmlId,
                             double time)
        Gracefully stops all behaviors in the block; that is: calls their interrupt and removes them from the plan

      • interruptBehaviour

        void interruptBehaviour(java.lang.String bmlId,
                        java.lang.String behaviourId,
                        double time)
        Gracefully interrupts a behavior. That is: calls their interrupt and removes them from the plan

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Clean up resources constructed with the planner (e.g. for native stuff, spawned threads, ...). A planner should not be (re)used after shutting it down.

      • play

        void play(double time)

      • verifyTime

        void verifyTime(double time)
        Generally, the Engine will call player.play(time). Sometimes, however, play(time) is already called from somewhere else (e.g., the AnimationPlayerManager, or a separate playing thread). In that case, the engine will not call player.play(time) but rather player.verifyTime(time). The player can use this call to check whether the timestamps it gets from the play() calls still sync well with the time stamps on which the engine is running
